# Sensitivity to Selection Criteria

The Sensitivity to Selection Criteria module summarizes demographic
makeup and fact distribution differences between a base cohort
definition and alternate cohort definitions. This functionality will
allow users to assess which cohort definition best fits their needs in a
study context.

## Installation

You can install the development version of this package like so:

``` r
devtools::install_github('ssdqa/sensitivityselectioncriteria')
```

# Package index

## Module Execution

- [`ssc_process()`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_process.md)
  : Sensitivity to Selection Criteria
- [`ssc_output()`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_output.md)
  : Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation

## Sample Input

- [`ssc_domain_file`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_domain_file.md)
  : SSC Sample Domain File
- [`ssc_outcome_file`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_outcome_file.md)
  : SSC Sample Outcomes Concept Set
- [`ssc_omop_demographics`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_omop_demographics.md)
  : SSC Demographic Mappings – OMOP
- [`ssc_pcornet_demographics`](https://ssdqa.github.io/sensitivityselectioncriteria/reference/ssc_pcornet_demographics.md)
  : SSC Demographic Mappings – PCORnet
